channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024030586
item.description:
Report X-2024030586

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SOUTH SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY SIX POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING A DNA MEDICAL KIT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED ALDEVRON, TEMPERATURE SENSITIVE PRODUCT WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER F770E0, OVERLAND PHARMACEUTICALS, 200 CLARENDON ST, BOSTON MA 02116-5021.

Damaged hazmat was put in lined hazmat tote and taken to the Hazmat cage for processing DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was bagged in plastic and management directed QA to take it for processing

item.title: Report X-2024030335
item.description:
Report X-2024030335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: External packaging was wet on all four sides, top and bottom and subsequently placed into a plastic lined container and removed from the discovery site. DescribePack: The cap was unsealed such that the liquid seeped from where the bottom edge circumference joined with the bottle neck. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent material , and the rest of the shipment was encapsulated within a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

item.title: Report E-2024030190
item.description:
Report E-2024030190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal ULX experienced a UN1727 Ammonium Biflouride release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bag and released material were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining bags were re-stacked and secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: QA was called from management and Package was placed upright and absorbent was placed to clean the spill

item.title: Report X-2024030171
item.description:
Report X-2024030171

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024030178
item.description:
Report E-2024030178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: BAKERSFIELD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBF experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide release from (2) 50-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25 pounds of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to a forklift accident. The damaged bags and released material were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining bags were re-stacked and secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024030271
item.description:
Report X-2024030271

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment external packaging was wet from internal spillage and the package was place into a plastic lined container and removed from the discovery site. DescribePack: The edge circumference of the can was dented on one side such that the lid did not fit properly to the can body despite the presence of can clips to secure it. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up by absorbent material. The rest of the package was placed into as plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Exterior packaging shows signs of leakage from the liquid staining on the box. Inside are 3 qty of 32 fl oz plastic container of Equate 70% Isopropyl Alcohol. DescribePack: 1 of the bottles had a cracked cap and spill all its contents. The other bottle was crushed from the top of the body as it was dented down and leaked 2 fl oz. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Immediately placed the package inside a plastic lined container and wiped off any spills found.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: FULL REGULATED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM THE SWAK SLIDE VIA OVERHEAD SORTER WITH OUT OF SPEC CLASS 3 LABEL (PRINTED IN BLACK AND WHITE) AND WITHOUT OP-900. HAS BEEN MISLOADED BY ORIGIN AND BEEN IN NEED OF HAP SINCE JAN 18TH TO FEB 22ND. UNDER FURTHER INSPECTION OF GOODS, FOUND THAT THE BOTTLE HAS LOST MATERIALS, NOT A FULL GALLON. DescribePack: BOTTLE LEAKED 2 TENTHS OF A GALLON FROM CAP OVER A PERIOD OF OVER A MONTH. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAER NOTIFIED ME OF PACKAGE LOCATED WITHIN THE TRUCK. I PROCEDED TO PREPARE A TOTE AND NEUTRILIZER FOR CLEANUP. I ISLOATED PACKAGE WITHIN THE CAGE TO AWAIT DISPOSITION. PACKAGE WAS ATTEMPTED TO BE DELIVERED AND WAS REFUSED DUE TO DAMAGE. DescribePack: SMALL CRACK LOCATED AT THE LOP OF THE LID THUS MAKING THE LID LOOSEN AND SPILL THE CONTENTS FROM WITHIN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS BAGGED BY THE DRIVER TO PREVENT CONTENTS TO CONTAMINATE OTHER ITEMS.

item.title: Report X-2024030357
item.description:
Report X-2024030357

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The Damaged Hazmat came down the sorter onto the flex. The package was discovered to be wet from the side of the package. The package was then placed into a red bin and Hazmat bag to be properly worked on. DescribePack: The package when discovered had a wet spot on the side of the box about 3 inches in length. Upon opening the package, it was viewed to be caused by a loose cap on one of the bottles of Zep Liquid heat. The loose cap leaked out liquid onto itself, another bottle, and the box. The loose cap had loose play to it compared to the others which had a tightly placed cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a red bin and hazmat bag in case any of its contents continued to leak. The package was also placed up in accordance with its load arrows to prevent any more spillage.

item.title: Report E-2024030172
item.description:
Report E-2024030172

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: BREA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 29, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1789 was crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, tires, and asphalt parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. PES crews utilized a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads on the impacted trailer and tires. The deployed granular absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. Crews deployed a neutralizing solution onto the impacted asphalt and worked them in with hand tools. All UN1789-impacted material was collected and containerized into the previously generated 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030157
item.description:
Report E-2024030157

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum, and they deployed granular absorbents to the released product and swept them in with hand tools. One (1) 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents, PPE, and any cleanup debris was staged in the terminal's waste holding room along with the 85-gallon salvage drum that contained the damaged drum. All undamaged freight was staged on the dock for further handling by R+L personnel.

item.title: Report E-2024030150
item.description:
Report E-2024030150

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: LIVERMORE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5-gallons of UN2672 Ammonium Hydroxide (10-35%) released from a 5-gallon poly jug due to a forklift puncture impacting a 1'X5' area of the trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Absorbents were applied in the trailer and swept up. Soda Ash solution was used to neutralize the impacted area. Impacted absorbents, PPE and the empty jug were containerized and overpacked into one 55-gallon poly drum of waste and staged in terminal OS&D for disposal.
